TITLE: Slowing Inflation Could Intensify Fed Debate Over When to Stop Raising Rates
SUMMARY: The Fed remains on track to lift interest rates by 0.5 percentage point on Wednesday to fight high inflation, but two straight months of moderating price pressures could complicate officials’ deliberations over how high to raise rates early next year.

TITLE: Prices for Used Cars, Plane Tickets and Electricity Eased in November
SUMMARY: Inflation report showed costs for food and shelter rising, but at slower rates than previous months.

TITLE: Europe Strikes Deal to Tax Imports Based on Greenhouse-Gas Emissions
SUMMARY: The European Union agreed to impose a tax on imports based on the greenhouse gases emitted to make them, inserting climate-change regulation for the first time into the rules of global trade.

TITLE: Tesla Investors Voice Concern Over Elon Musk's Focus on Twitter
SUMMARY: Supporters of both Tesla and Musk have been asking questions about who is running the electric-vehicle maker.

TITLE: WWE's McMahon Faces Fresh Demands Over Sex-Abuse Claims
SUMMARY: Actions come as wrestling-company board assesses damage caused by the former CEO’s secret hush pacts.

TITLE: Instagram Challenges BeReal and Adds Notes Feature
SUMMARY: With fresh ways to connect with friends, is Instagram trying to be Instagram again?

TITLE: States Demand Mature-Content Rating for TikTok
SUMMARY: A group of 15 attorneys general demanded that Google and Apple strip the video-sharing app of a rating that classifies it as appropriate for teens.

TITLE: WeWork's Once Robust Cash Reserves Have Dwindled, Raising Chances of Default
SUMMARY: Recession fears and tech-industry job cuts are lowering demand for co-working desks. Meanwhile, money-losing companies such as WeWork are hurt by higher interest rates.

TITLE: Six Signs Your Hybrid Workplace Plan Isn't Working
SUMMARY: It isn’t just about getting employees into the office when you tell them to. It’s about making sure they are productive and creative.

TITLE: Fentanyl Awareness Campaign Urges Parents to 'Drop the F-Bomb' With Their Kids
SUMMARY: A new campaign from the Ad Council and Meta is encouraging parents of teen and young-adult children to speak to them about the dangers of fentanyl.

TITLE: FTX's Sam Bankman-Fried Charged With Criminal Fraud, Conspiracy
SUMMARY: U.S. prosecutors, in an indictment unsealed Tuesday, accused the crypto exchange’s founder of a scheme to defraud customers and his hedge fund’s lenders.

TITLE: SpaceX Eyes Higher Valuation in Offering Employee Shares for Sale
SUMMARY: The Elon Musk-led company reached a $125 billion valuation during a fundraising round earlier this year.

TITLE: Supermarkets Push Store Brands to Lure Cost-Conscious Shoppers
SUMMARY: Consumers in the U.S. and Europe are gravitating toward stores’ cheaper private-label products as inflation hits disposable incomes.

TITLE: Pandemic Loans Are Coming Due but Some Businesses Aren't Ready to Repay
SUMMARY: Borrowers grapple with a slower-than-expected rebound and new economic challenges.

TITLE: Microsoft Invests in Silicon-Battery Material Upstart
SUMMARY: Group14, now valued above $3 billion, also got a $100 million government grant to boost domestic battery production.

TITLE: Sales Rise at Zara Owner Despite Economic Chill
SUMMARY: The gains come against a backdrop of record-low consumer confidence in Europe in recent months, as high inflation hits disposable incomes.

TITLE: U.K. Inflation Eases, Following Global Trend
SUMMARY: The annual rate of inflation fell in November, a fresh sign that the surge in consumer prices around the world since early last year is easing as household spending power declines and central banks push borrowing costs higher.
